titleStmt.title: Miracles of Mary, Miracles of Cyricus, Salutation to you, Threshold of the East…, Miracles of Libānos

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation by Ethio-SPaRE, in pencil, in the outer corner of the bottom margin.

collation.note: The structure of many quires is difficult to discern because of the parchment guards.
collation.signatures: Undecorated quire marks are written in the upper margin, in the main hand: 1r: ፩, 89r: ፪, 97r: ፫, 105r: ፬, 111r:፭, 119r:፮. In a recent hand: 15r: ፫, 23r: ፬, 31r: ፭, 39r: ፮, 47r: ፯, 57r: ፰, 65r: ፱, 76r: ፲, 88r: ፩, 105r: ፪, 118r: ፫.

list.item:
፩ 7
s.l.: 3, stub after 4 s.l.: 4, stub after 3 s.l.: 7, stub after 7 The structure of the quire is uncertain.

item.note: The structure of the quire is uncertain.

Leaf 1 () might have originally belonged to the quire before (the quire number ፯ appears on leaf 2). The scructure of the quire is uncertain; no stub could be detected that would indicate which leaf is single.
The scructure of the quire is uncertain; no stub could be detected that would indicate which leaf is single.

list.item:
፩ 16
s.l. 4: stub after 13 s.l. 7: stub after 11 This quire has probably been misplaced and originally belonged to the beginning of the book (or is composed of some three quires from the beginning, put together). Number ፪ is written on leaf 2; number ፫ on leaf 9.

፬ 13
s.l. 2: stub after 12 s.l. 3: stub after 11 s.l. 4: stub after 10 s.l. 6: stub after 9 s.l. 8 stub after 8 s.l. 11: stub after 3 s.l. 12: stub after 2 Number ፪ is written near the quire number ፬, in a secondary recent hand. Number ፭ in the original hand appears on leaf 7.

item.note: Quire number ፮ written in the original hand appears on leaf 2.

list.note: The structure of this quire, composed of damaged leaves severed from each other, is difficult to ascertain.

supportDesc.condition: The manuscript is very worn and damaged. A part of each board is broken off (or, possibly, parts of broken boards originating from a different manuscript have been used). The manuscript has been crudely rebound; all quires are reinfored with parchement guards. Several leaves appear to have been lost between and (see the break in the text, a gap in the numbering of the miracles). The leaves are mutilated. The leaf is of smaller size The last quire consists of several worn and damaged folia, possibly originating from different codices. Some folia are misplaced (e.g. , , see above on ). Holes and tears are carefully amended on .

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards (possibly secondary, made of remains of broken boards originally used for other manuscripts).

history.origin:
ʿUrā Qirqos
Around the middle of or the second half of the 18th century. The original codex Unit 1 produced for the community of the church was later expanded by Unit 2 and Unit 3.

msItem.title: Maṣḥafa śǝrʿāt, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah
msItem.incipit: በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፡ ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ተአምር፡ ዘይትነበብ፡ እምቅድመ፡ ያንብቡ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ሥርዓት፡ ዘወፅአ፡ እምንበረ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ሐዋርያ፡ እመካነ፡ መዓልቃ፡ ዘምስር፡ ዘአንበሩ፡ መምህራን፡ መጋብያነ፡ ምሥጢር፡ ርቱዓነ፡ ሃይማኖት። In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, One God. This book of rules that came from the seat of Mark the Apostle, from the church of al-Muʿallaqah of Mǝsr wherein the doctors, the glorious patriarchs, the treasurers of the mystery, the righteous had laid it up.
msItem.explicit: ለከ፡ ይደሉ፡ ስብሐት፡ በጽዮን፨ ወለከ፡ ይትፈና፡ ጸሎት፡ በኢየሩሳሌም፨ ስማዕ፡ ጸሎተ፡ ዘሥጋ፡

msItem.title: Introductory exhortation
msItem.incipit:
ተአምር፡ ዘይትነበብ፡ በሰን
በተ፡ ክርስቲያን። ንነግረክሙ፡ ኦአኃዊነ፡ ፍቁራን፡ ውሉደ፡ ቤተ፡ ከርስቲያን፨ እግዚአብሔር፡ ይባርክሙ፡ ወያብርህ፡ አዕይንተ፡ አልባቢክሙ፡ ለሰሚዓ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ በካልኤ፡ ማርያም፡ The foreword of the miracles which to be read during the Christian Sunday. We will tell you, our brothers, children of the church, may God bless you and enlighten the eyes of your hearts to listen to the miracles of our Lady Mary, the holy and twofold Virgin.
msItem.explicit:
ቅዱሳን፡ ወንጹሐን፡ ድንግልናኪ፡ እለ፡ ይሴብሑ። ኀበ፡ ሥዕልኪ፡ እንዘ፡ ይጸርኁ፡
ብርሃነ፡ ጸጋኪ፡ ይትሞጥሑ፡ ኀበ፡ ቤተ፡ መርዓሁ፡ ለወልድኪ፡ ያንፈርዕፁ፡ ወይትፌሥሑ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ በስራሕ፨

msItem.title: I worship Thee…
msItem.incipit: እሰግድ፡ ለኪ፡ እሰግድ፡ ለኪ፡ ወእዌድሰኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትየ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ለመርዓዊ፡ ሰማይ፡ መርዓዊ፡ ጽርሑ፨ በከመ፡ ወደሰኪ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ አፈ፡ ወርቅ፡ በመኃልይሁ፡

msItem.colophon: ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘዑራ፡ ወጢንየ፡ ቃሉ፡ ዘኢይኈ ነገሩ፡ ፈጸምኩ፡ አነ፡ እንተ፡ በዕበዩ፡ ለቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ መስተጋድል፡ ኢረከብኩ፡ እንበለ፡ ማቅ፡ ኢፈትል፡ ከመ፡ይትዋኅሰኒ፡ በመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ ያብኣኒ፡ ውስተ፡ ጽርሑ፡ ሐዳስ፡ እለ፡ አጽሐፍዋ፡ ወዘጸሐፉ፡ ይጽ ኀበ፡ ዓምደ፡ ወርቅ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን።

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
layout.note: On some folia the horizontal ruled lines extend to the vertical pricks, i.e. are of type A (see ).

handNote.seg: Divine names; name of the donor; groups of lines on the incipit pages of the texts; incipits of texts, incipit of sections and of subsections (sometimes only the first word); the word tafaśśǝḥi in Text I-3; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
handNote.desc: Careful, somewhat irregular; by a mediocre scribe. Similar to Hand 2 but superior in quality. Zawalda Māryām is mentioned as the scribe in the supplication formulas on (probably the same scribe as the one of ). On another person, Mǝḫḍǝnta Māryām , is referred to as a scribe, most probably by mistake.

item.desc: One word crudely writen in pencil, in the upper margin

Corrections on some folia: erasures marked with think lines, omitted words are written interlenearly in the main Hand 1, sometimes in smaller script, expunctuations mainly for dittographic mistakes (cp. )

Readings are indicated by the names of the feasts and other occasions written in the upper margin, in the main hand , encircled with dots or black and/or red lines. : ወሶበ፡ ጸሐፈ፡ ደቅስዮስ። በሚካኤል፡ ምንባብ, : በቅኪ፡ አድኅኖ፡ ለበላዒ, : በደናግል፡ ምንባብ, : ዘዓንቅዓ፡ ማይ, : በቅደሴ፡ ቤታ, : በልደታ፡ ወበደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ ምንባብ፡, : አኮኑ፡ ብእሲ, : ሰበ፡ ወሀበኪ፡ ዘልፈ, : አብራዊ፡ ብፁዕ, : ለድምያኖስ፡ ዘኪ, : አመ፡ እዴሁ፡ መተረ፡ ነሢኦ, : ይስሐቅ፡ መነኮስ, : ዘአትሎኪያ፡ ማ, : ምስለ፡ ዓራቱ፡ ዘዕፅ, : ዓፀደ፡ ማርያም, : ዘካርያስ፡ መሬዛ, : ኃይለኪ፡ ማርያም below, : አረባውያን፡ እደው, : ኃይለኪ፡ ጽኑዓ፡ ወመንከረኪ, : ተወኪፈኪ፡ ስእለቶ፡ እ፡፡, : ሕደወት፡ ሐመማን, : በተንሣኤ፡ ምንባብ, : በገሪማ፡ ምንባብ, : በደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ አንብብ, : በሚካኤል፡ ምንባብ, : በዓርብ፡ ስቅለት, : በማኅሌት፡ ምንባብ, : በደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ ምንባብ, : በሆሣዕና፡ ምንባብ, : በሳሙኤል፡ ምንባብ, : አንቅዓ፡ እምታሕተ፡ እግራ, : በልደታ፡ ምንባብ, : በጽዮን, : , : በቊጽረታ ዘልደታ፡ እ፩ለግንቦት, : ዘልደታ፡ እ፩ለግንቦት, : በበአታ፡ ቤተ፡ መቅደስ, : በገብርኤል, : በልደቱ፡ ለመድኃኒነ, : በአስተርእዮ, : በሞታ፡ በፍልሰታ, : በፍልሰታ፡, : በሕንጸታ፡ በቅዳሴ, : በሕንጸታ።, : በመስቀል, : በሚካኤል.

history.origin: Around the middle of in the second half of the 18th century. Unit 1 was produced as circulation unit and was in intensive use. The text was copied by Zawalda Māryām. The manucript was obviously commissioned by a big group of community members of ʿUrā Qirqos, such as ʿAsba Māryām (e.g. ), Burǝkt Māryām (e.g. and many other folia), Gabra Dəngəl (e.g. ), Mǝḫḍǝnta Māryām (e.g. ), Fǝqura Māryām (), Zaqʷasqʷ ām (), Takla Mikāʾel (), ʾabuna Zawalda Māryām (), Dəngəl Māryām (), ʿAmda Giyorgis (), ʿAmda Masqal and a female called ʾAwād (e.g. and some other flia). Elsewhere supplication formulas refers summarily to "all children of Qirqos", and "all children of this place", (cp. also ).

collation.note: Production unit is composed of only two quires of smaller size.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handNote.desc: Careful, but not very regular; by a mediocre scribe. Very similar to Hand 1 but inferior to it. Rounded letter shapes. Walda Tǝnśāʾe is mentioned as the scribe on .

history.origin: Second half of the 18th century. Unit 2 is of somewhat later time than Unit 1; it was unlikely meant to be an independent circulation unit. The text was copied by Walda Tǝnśāʾe (see ). Priest Kǝfla Māryām is mentioned as the commissioner on , Walatta Krǝstos, mentioned several times, might be his relative.

msItem.title: Miracle 1. About a pious king who accept to be a priest in the land of Roḥa
msItem.incipit: በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፡ ነዋ፡ ጸሐፍነተ፡ አምሪሁ፡ ለቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ ንስቲተ፡ እምብዙኃ፡ ከመ፡ ኢይኩን፡ ዝንጋዔ፡ ለሰማዕያን፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ክፍለ፡ ማርያም፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ወሀሎ፡ ፩ንጉሥ፡ ጻድቅ፡ ዘተወክፈ፡ ሢመተ፡ ክህነት፡ እምአፈ፡ አምላኩ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮሐ፡ ቅድስት፡

msItem.title: Miracle 2. About a believer in a church dedicated to Qirqos
Miracle 3. Story about about a poor monk from a distant country who was sewing clothes
Miracle 4. About a monk called Eli (ʾElyās)
msItem.note: This Miracle is added by Hand 2 (of Walda Tǝnśāʾe).

msItem.title: Salutation to you, treshold of the East...
msItem.note: In Hand 2 Walda Tǝnśāʾe. There are two words in the upper line of the folium looking like the end of another text that could not be identified (possible there was another leaf befor which is missing now).

msItem.title: One miracle of Libānos
msItem.incipit: ተአምሪሁ፡ ለአቡነ፡ ሊባኖስ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሀሉ፡ መስለ፡ ገብሩ፡ ክፍለ፡ ማርያም፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ወካዕበ፡ ይቢሉኒ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ ስርናይ፡ ምልዕልተ፡ ናሕስ፡ ዘቤተ፤ ክርስቲያንኑ፤ ዘአንበርዎ፡ ወድዮሙ፡ ሐሰል፡ ከመ፡ ይትዓቀብ፡ ህየ፡

msItem.title: Miracle of Jesus: Healing of the blind man by Jesus
msItem.incipit: ተአምር፡ ዘገብረ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ በብእሲ፡ ዕዉር፡ ወጽሙም፡ ወበሃም፡ በሃገረ፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡ ወከማሁ፡ ይግበር፡ ትእምርቶ፡ ሠይተ፡ ለዕለ፡ ገብሩ፡ ክፍለ፡ ማርያም፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ወእንዘ፡ የሐልፍ፡ እግዚእ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡ ሃገረ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ርእየ፡ ብእሴ፡ ዘዕውሩ፡ ተወልደ፡
msItem.note: The folium with the last remaining part of the miracle is misplaced, cp. the end of the text on , ዘተነበዩ፡ ነቢያት፡ በእንቲአከ፡ አንተ፡ ውእቱ፡ ገባሪሁ፡ ለአዳ, and the continuation on , ም፡ ወበእንተ፡ አፍቅሮተከ" ኪያነ፡ ለበስከ፡ ሥጋ፡ ሰብእ" ከመ፡ ትሠሃለኒ፡ ኦወልደ፡ ዳዊት፡ . The handwriting looks somewhat different because of thicker pen nib and different hue of the black ink, but it seems to be still the same Hand 2 ( Walda Tǝnśāʾe).

collation.note: Unit 3 is composed of only one destroyed quire , of heterogeneous origin.

layout.note: All data taken from . The number of written lines is different on , up to 25.

The bottom line is written above the ruling.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handNote.desc: Careful, regular; by a mediocre scribe.

item.desc: A note concerning the commissioner, partly cut.
item.q: አነ፡ ዘአጽሐፍኩ፡ ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቂርቆስ፡ ሕፃን፡ ፬፡ ዑኒ፡

item.desc: Unreadable note or text in the bottom margin

history.origin: Second half of the 18th century. Unit 3 is composed of leaves produced for Kǝfla Māryām (the owner of Unit 2), probably some time after Unit 1 and Unit 2.The texts have been copied by anonymous and the scribe of Unit 2, Hand 2 (Walda Tǝnśāʾe).

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
